group.label: Top Menu
group.comment:
Configuration of the top menu displayed in the header of the page.
Style of the drop-down can be configured individually for each category in category settings.
More info can be found in the User Guide (chapter 12).

field.label: Top Menu
field.comment: Enable the horizontal drop-down menu.

field.label: Remove Top Menu On Home Page
field.comment: Remove the top menu on the home page. This option may be useful when you use the sidebar menu on your home page.

field.label: Mode
field.comment:
- Drop-down - standard drop-down menu
- Mobile - collapsible accordion, dedicated for mobile websites
- Drop-down/Mobile - combination of both modes, dedicated for responsive websites

field.label: Display Categories
field.comment: Display categories in the top menu.

field.label: Vertical Layout
field.comment: The top menu displayed inside a drop-down box.

field.label: Vertical Drop-down Menu
field.comment: Enable vertical drop-down menu. The menu (categories stacked vertically) will be placed inside a drop-down box which will be shown when user clicks a button inside the menu bar.

field.label: Collapsed
field.comment: If set to "Yes", the drop-down box with the menu will be collapsed. If set to "No", the drop-down box with the menu will not be collapsed and all the top-level items will be visible.

field.label: Collapsed On Home Page
field.comment: If set to "Yes", the drop-down box with the menu will be collapsed on home page.

field.label: Home Link
field.comment: An icon and text "Home", displayed as a standard menu item.

field.label: Home Link: Text
field.comment: If enabled, will display menu item with text "Home" as a link to the home page. This link will be displayed with the same colors as other menu items.

field.label: Home Link: Icon
field.comment: If enabled, will display menu item with icon as a link to the home page. This link will be displayed with the same colors as other menu items.

field.label: Single Icon as Home Link
field.comment: Alternatively, you can enable this option to show single icon as a link to the home page. The icon will be displayed without any additional background color. If it's enabled, options Home Link: Text and Home Link: Icon will be ignored.

field.label: Centered
field.comment: If set to "Yes", menu items will be centered within the menu bar.

field.label: Align Drop-down With...
field.comment:
The drop-down box (of top-level category) will be aligned with the right edge of the selected container if the right edge of the drop-down box sticks out further to the right than the selected container.
- Viewport - drop-down box will be aligned with the user's visible area of the page.
- Menu bar - drop-down box will be aligned with the right edge of the menu bar.
- Primary header, inner container - drop-down box will be aligned with the inner container of the primary header section.

field.label: Full-width Drop-down As Wide As...
field.comment:
If a drop-down box of a top-level category was set as full-width ("Submenu Type" field was set to "Mega drop-down" and "Drop-down Width" field was left empty), it will be as wide as the selected container.
Note: width of drop-down box can be configured individually for each category in category settings.

field.label: Custom Static Block - Align Right
field.comment:
Align custom static block to the right side of the menu bar. To add custom static block to the menu you need to create a static block with ID block_header_nav_dropdown in CMS > Static Blocks. Content of that static block will be displayed as a drop-down box.
Note: to add a custom drop-down block to the menu you can also do the following: create a new category and add your content to the "Top Block" field which can be found in the "Menu" tab in category settings. This way you can add multiple custom drop-down blocks to the menu. More info can be found in the user guide.

field.label: Show Bullets Inside Mega Drop-down
field.comment: If set to "Yes", 3rd-level subcategories inside mega drop-downs will be marked with bullets (small ">" marks).

field.label: Threshold
field.comment:
Width of the browser viewport (in pixels), below which the drop-down menu turns into a mobile menu (an accordion) dedicated for mobile devices. The threshold is needed only if the top menu is in Drop-down/Mobile mode.
Horizontal menu: it's recommended to leave the default value of the treshold: 992. Values below 992 are not recommended - horizontal drop-down menus usually don't look good on narrow screens.
Vertical menu: if the Vertical Drop-down Menu is enabled, it's recommended to set the treshold to 770.

field.label: Show Category Blocks From X Levels of Categories
field.comment: Specify number of levels of categories (counting from the top level) for which category blocks will be displayed in the mobile menu. E.g. enter 1 to display blocks of 1st-level categories, enter 2 to display blocks of 1st-level and 2nd-level categories etc. The allowed range is from 0 to 5. Enter 0 to hide blocks of all categories on all levels.

field.label: Hide Category Blocks Below 480px
field.comment: Category blocks will be hidden in mobile menu on small mobile devices (if width of the browser viewport is below 480px).

field.label: Show Categories With Category Blocks Only
field.comment: Top-level categories, which have no subcategories but have category blocks, will be displayed in mobile menu. A category can have category blocks inside the dropdown if the Submenu Type field of that category (in category settings) was set to "Mega drop-down" and if any content was added to one of the content fields (e.g. to the Top Block field).

group.label: Sidebar Menu
group.comment:
Configuration of the sidebar menu which can be displayed in sidebars on selected pages (if the page has any sidebars).
Important: you can also use block shortcode to display the sidebar menu inside any custom static block.
More info can be found in the User Guide (chapter 12).

field.label: Enable Sidebar Menu
field.comment: Enable the sidebar menu for different types of pages.

field.label: Product Page (Main Sidebar)
field.comment: By default a product page have no sidebars, so you need to change the layout of a product page to display the sidebar menu. You can change the layout in product's settings.

field.label: Product Page (Additional Sidebar)
field.comment: By default a product page have no sidebars, so you need to change the layout of a product page to display the sidebar menu. You can change the layout in product's settings.

field.label: Sidebar Mega Menu
field.comment: Enable sidebar mega menu. If not enabled, the sidebar menu will be displayed as a simple accordion. Additional settings for accordion can be found below.

field.label: Use Sidebar Mega Menu As Mobile Menu
field.comment: When the sidebar menu exists on the page, it will be used as mobile menu (when mobile menu is displayed).

field.label: Block Title
field.comment: Additionally you can use variable [current_category] inside the title to create dynamic name of the block. Variable will be replaced with the name of the current category.

field.label: Accordion Settings
field.comment: If the "Sidebar Mega Menu" is not enabled, the sidebar menu will be displayed as a simple accordion.

field.label: Parent Category
field.comment: The menu will only contain children (subcategories) of the selected parent category.

field.label: Maximum Depth
field.comment: This parameter controls how many levels in the hierarchy of Categories (starting from the parent category) are to be included in the menu. Menu with a Maximum Depth of 1 will just be an un-nested list of categories from a single level (with none of the subcategories displayed). The default value is 0, it will display all subcategories.

field.label: Fallback To Root Category
field.comment:
If current category doesn't exist, go back to root category. This option is useful if sidebar menu should be displayed on pages with no current category (on pages other than category view). If set to “Yes” and if current category doesn't exist, menu will behave like Parent Category field was set to “Root” (it will display top-level categories).
Important: if set to "No", menu will not be displayed at all if there's no current category.

field.label: Fallback Block Title
field.comment: This block title will be used if current category doesn't exist.

field.label: Show Number of Products
field.comment: Important: this option can affect performance. Use only if needed.

field.label: Hide Sidebar Menu on Mobile Devices
field.comment: Sidebar menu can be hidden on mobile devices (if browser viewport is narrower than 768 pixels). By default all categories are displayed in the top menu so with this option you can save some space on mobile devices.

field.label: Label 1
field.comment: Define the text of the category label 1. Labels can be assigned to every category in Catalog > Manage Categories.

field.label: Label 2
field.comment: Define the text of the category label 2. Labels can be assigned to every category in Catalog > Manage Categories.
